Articles.Content: It’s not often that we see a new first in KSP these days, but Cory just made our week with this video in which he flies by all the planets and moons in the Kerbal solar system using nothing more than a Kerbal’s jetpack and a handful of refills along the way. Honestly, this is one of the greatest KSP achievements we’ve had the pleasure of seeing. Go see it too.
Link his profile! I need to give him rep NOW!
Er.. Isn't this impossible as you cannot make accurate burns as an EVA Kerbal?

> 
> Link his profile! I need to give him rep NOW!

Right now. This video is the great gdamn thing I've seen. Brilliant use of (gorgeous) "stations."

Impressive. However. can you go from the Hubble Space Telescope to the I.S.S. with NO refills and dragging another person, because George Clooney figured that one out.

(Seriously though, really awesome job)

I am the video's creator. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Er.. Isn't this impossible as you cannot make accurate burns as an EVA Kerbal?

Kerbals are automatically oriented in the normal axis while on EVA, so North/South burns are easiest to get right. For radial and prograde burns, I look at map view to find a visible target (usually the body I am orbiting). Early in the mission, I would try to either face the Kerbal toward the body or toward prograde before burning, but reorientation is an expensive waste of propellant so as I got better I would just approximate the burn from whatever direction I was already facing.

Regarding burn magnitude: For big burns, I calculated out how much propellant it's going to take and/or how long the burn should last. (The full jetpack is 620 m/s and acceleration is about 3 m/s/s.) For small burns, I make very small inputs then switch back and forth to map view to see how I'm doing. Since the jetpack does not have a throttle, burns need to be at least 0.3 m/s or else you will overshoot the burn. For very tiny orbital burns, that means waiting until you are closer to your target in lots of cases. (There were a ton of deep space corrective burns not shown in this video because frankly they are boring.)
Amazing. Simply that.

> 
> I am the video's creator. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

That was such a cool mission. I bet after 192yrs that kerbal was so relieved to get out of that spacesuit and have some snacks. have rep+
He looks so tired at he end of the video.
Nice clouds!

> 
> Er.. Isn't this impossible as you cannot make accurate burns as an EVA Kerbal?

You can make an accurate burn in an EVA suit, you just can't use maneuver nodes to do so.
Not only is the mission realy cool. Also the video is cut nicely together. And the hotpants flag ist funny ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Right, now there's nothing else you could possibly do in KSP. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

How many quicksaves/quickloads did you do?

> 
> I am the video's creator. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Wow! That's impressive. First time I've seen it done. good Job!
jaw dropped. tears of joy congratulations you just beat ksp.

A long time ago I managed to send a kerbal to the Mun, land and return him to Kerbin using the jetpack, infinite fuel and hacked gravity.

This blows that achievement completely out of the water.

Excellent work.
Level 5.

> How many quicksaves/quickloads did you do?

I am scared to admit. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) It is >100. I am a quicksave spammer.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-23T03:59:04Z" title="07/23/2015 03:59  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 23, 2015</time> by chicknblender**

omg, the look of fear that one time on the kerbal's face....he just ate some reconstituted beans and realized he was gonna have gas....and can you imagine the smell of that suit after all those years.............
And here I am struggling to do a normal Grand tour...
I sir am humbled by your video, I loved every part of it, the music, the effort, the skill. One of my top 3 KSP videos of all time.
That moment when someone got more rep then you from one video then you ever got from your 5 months on the forums. Great vid though!

mind->blown

jaw->floored

rep->given

How much RL planning went into this?!

I don't even... eh... er.... wow.... just..... wow.....

THAT is the single most amazing feat of Kerbalkind since the magic boulder was banished and the 1.0 update.
This...needs...to become...a challenge for ksp players!!!
